question: Who among the following is not considered as a "New Liberal"?
explanation: T. H. Green (1836–82), L. T. Hobhouse (1864–1929) and J. A. Hobson (1854–1940) are known as 'New Liberals' because they believed that the unrestrained pursuit of profit, as advocated by classical liberalism, had given rise to new and different forms of poverty and injustice.
